newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar ends firmer on late U.S. dlr selling.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar ends firmer on late U.S. dlr selling.

text.p: Late U.S. dollar selling by foreign institutions pulled the Taiwan dollar higher at the close on Friday, dealers said.
The local unit fell to as low as T$27.663 to a dollar at one stage, but profit-taking on the American currency in late trading strengthened the local dollar, dealers said.
The local unit ended at an intraday high of $27.625, compared with Thursday's T$27.648 close. Turnover through dealers was an active US$256.5 million.
"The forces of (U.S. dollar) selling and buying have been quite balanced recently, so there should not be drastic movements in the foreign exchange market," said one dealer.
A $27.60-65 trading range was seen in the near term.
